Package neureka.fluent.building

Class TensorBuilder<V>

java.lang.Object
neureka.fluent.building.TensorBuilder<V>
Type Parameters:
V - The type of the values which ought to be represent by the Tsr built by this TensorBuilder.
All Implemented Interfaces:
IterByOrIterFromOrAll<V>, Step<V>, To<V>, WithShapeOrScalarOrVector<V>, WithShapeOrScalarOrVectorOnDevice<V>
public final class TensorBuilder<V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements WithShapeOrScalarOrVectorOnDevice<V>, IterByOrIterFromOrAll<V>, To<V>, Step<V>
This class exposes a fluent builder API for creating Tsr instances. An simple example would be: 


    Tsr.of(Double.class)
          .withShape( 2, 3, 4 )
          .iterativelyFilledBy( 5, 3, 5 )
It is also possible to define a range using the API to populate the tensor with values: 


    Tsr.of(Double.class)
          .withShape( 2, 3, 4 )
          .iterativelyFilledFrom( 2 ).to( 9 ).step( 2 )
If one needs a simple scalar then the following shortcut is possible: 


    Tsr.of(Float.class).scalar( 3f )
This principle works for vectors as well: 


     Tsr.of(Byte.class).vector( 2, 5, 6, 7, 8 )
For more fine-grained control over the initialization one can pass an initialization lambda to the API: 


     Tsr.of(Byte.class).withShape(2, 3).andWhere( (i, indices) -> i * 5 - 30 )

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Tsr<V> all​(V value)
    This method creates and return a Tsr instance which will be homogeneously filled by the the provided value irrespective of the previously defined shape.
    Tsr<V> andFill​(V... values)
    Provide an array of values which will be used to fill the Tsr instance returned by this last fluent builder method.
    Tsr<V> andSeed​(java.lang.Object seed)
    This method creates and return a Tsr instance which will be filled based on the provided seed object.
    Tsr<V> andWhere​(Filler<V> filler)
    This method receives an Filler lambda which will be used to populate the Tsr instance produced by this API with values.
    To<V> iterativelyFilledFrom​(V index)
    This part of the builder API allows for specifying a range which starts from the provided value and will end at the value specified in the next builder step returned by this method.
    WithShapeOrScalarOrVector<V> on​(Device<V> device)  
    Tsr<V> scalar​(V value)
    This method created and return a scalar Tsr instance which wraps the provided value.
    Tsr<V> step​(double size)
    This is the last step in the call transition graph of the fluent builder API when building a Tsr instance populated based on the values within a defined range.
    Step<V> to​(V index)
    This step in the call transition graph of the fluent builder API is a followup call from the IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object) method which expects a range to be specified whose values will be used to populate the Tsr instance.
    Tsr<V> vector​(java.lang.Object[] values)
    This method created and return a vector Tsr instance which wraps the provided values.
    IterByOrIterFromOrAll<V> withShape​(int... shape)
    Define a tensor shape by passing an array of int values to this method, which represent the shape of the Tsr that should be built.

  • Method Details

    • andFill

      @SafeVarargs public final Tsr<V> andFill​(V... values)
      Description copied from interface: IterByOrIterFromOrAll
      Provide an array of values which will be used to fill the Tsr instance returned by this last fluent builder method. If the configured tensor is larger than the number of provided elements, then they will simply be read multiple times until the result has been sufficiently populated.
      Specified by:
      andFill in interface IterByOrIterFromOrAll<V>
      Parameters:
      values - The values which will recurrently populate the returned Tsr with values until it is filled.
      Returns:
      A new Tsr instance populated by the array of values supplied to this method.

    • andWhere

    • iterativelyFilledFrom

      public To<V> iterativelyFilledFrom​(V index)
      Description copied from interface: IterByOrIterFromOrAll
      This part of the builder API allows for specifying a range which starts from the provided value and will end at the value specified in the next builder step returned by this method. If the number in the created range is not sufficiently large enough to fully populate the final Tsr instance built by this API, then the resulting range will fill the underlying data array of the tensor recurrently.
      Specified by:
      iterativelyFilledFrom in interface IterByOrIterFromOrAll<V>
      Parameters:
      index - The start of the range which ought to supply the Tsr instance built by this API.
      Returns:
      The next step in the builder method chain which expects to receive the end point of the range.

    • to

      public Step<V> to​(V index)
      Description copied from interface: To
      This step in the call transition graph of the fluent builder API is a followup call from the IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object) method which expects a range to be specified whose values will be used to populate the Tsr instance. This method allows one to set the end point of the range whose start has previously between set in the IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object) method...
      Specified by:
      to in interface To<V>
      Parameters:
      index - The end point of the range previously specified in IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object).
      Returns:
      The last step in the call transition graph of the fluent builder API for building range based Tsr instances.

    • step

      public Tsr<V> step​(double size)
      Description copied from interface: Step
      This is the last step in the call transition graph of the fluent builder API when building a Tsr instance populated based on the values within a defined range. This method embodies the last part of this range definition which consists of the chained methods IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object), To.to(Object) and lastly this very method Step.step(double). This method allows one to set the step size used to space the entries within the previously defined span between what has been passed to IterByOrIterFromOrAll.iterativelyFilledFrom(Object) and what has been passed to To.to(Object)...
      Specified by:
      step in interface Step<V>
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the step within the range defined by this fluent builder API.
      Returns:
      A new Tsr instance whose contents are filled based on the provided range.
